channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Someone has dumped a chest of drawers on the pavement., 30th November
item.description:
There is a school up the road. Kids have already started breaking it apart after school and dumping rubbish in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle blocking residential access to alleyway, 30th November
item.description:
This car has been here for over a year and is blocking all the residents access to exit from the back garden on Florence Road and Abbey Road. This is a serious concern in the case of emergencies where an alternative exit of the properties is vital. It is now overgrown with brambles and encourages fly tipping and encouraging pests to enter our homes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Florence Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing wheelie bin, 29th November
item.description:
Wheelie bin from random property left incorrectly outside our building and now it’s overflowing and waste hasn’t been collected. Desperately needs collecting
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blackheath Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light on all day, 29th November
item.description:
This light has been on since mid July and has been reported before and no action has been taken. The light is outside no 11 Tavistock Road Bromley BR2 0SY
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tavistock Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bin for 4weeks+, 29th November
item.description:
Abandoned bin has been in front of our property for weeks now, despite several calls and reports to council. This is the second time it happened. It is flowing with rubbish and presents a health risk (rats, foxes etc). People walking on the street keep adding additional rubbish to it. Can it be collected ASAP please?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blackheath Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light on New River Path not illuminating, 29th November
item.description:
One of the street lights, ST454W, is no longer illuminating at night on the New River Path outside Heartlands High. It is noticably darker and less safe feeling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Hornsey, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Delaney Street, 29th November
item.description:
The road work causing a huge traffic and inconvenience to the road users. As the road is closed, traffic is diverted to Arlington Street and you get stuck in the traffic as the road is narrow and whole road gets blocked all the way to Parkway. The road work sign state that the road work is going to finish on 17/11/25 and it is now DECEMBER and still ongoing. Huge issue for those who need access to Albany Street...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Delancey Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food bin not collected and left in the road, 29th November
item.description:
Communal Food bin for the first block of flats on Alcock Crescent has not been collected. The bin men have dragged out the brown bin from the locked bin shed, but not collected it and left in the road/parking area. It is full and very heavy and hard to move, and smells. Needs collecting asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alcock Crescent, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large metal screen dumped, 29th November
item.description:
A large metal screen consisting of about five parts has been dumped on the pavement meaning a buggy or wheelchair might be unable to pass. It is also the same colour as the pavement so someone could easily trip over it in the dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plawsfield Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leaking up through burst watermain, 29th November
item.description:
Water is leaking up into the road by the bus stop even when it is not raining. there is not a drain here. This was a major problem recently it needs attending to or it will get worse very quickly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 204 - 212, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
